captions.text: This is the McLaren 650S.
And if you think it looks similar to the P1 it's for a good reason.
You see when you make one of the world's most powerful

fastest and extreme cars you learn a
thing or two.

And McLaren says that what it's
learned it's applied to the 12C
in effect creating the 650S.
It still uses a lightweight carbon fiber

tub and a dry sump plane 3.8 liter
twin-turbo V8,
but now it makes 641 horsepower and 500 pound feet or torque.
It is of course more powerful and faster

but its array of clever electronic tricks
been improved too.
From active aerodynamics and suspension control
McLaren says it's a better driver
thanks to new damper mounts and revised steering.
Press the launch button

wait two seconds for boost to build and
then the 650S
launches hard. Past the quarter mile at 10.7 seconds at a 134 miles an hour

it's nearly half a second faster than
the 12C
and it falls into the select group of production cars that can run
10s off the factory showroom. Breaking was good but less impressive

the 65S may have large carbon
ceramic rotors

but the power they put through the
Pirelli P-Zero tires
was only able to produce a best sixty to zero stop at a hundred five feet.
Around the figure eight
the 650S had a very respectable 23.1 lap with an average lateral G

First thing you should do you if ever find
yourself in the McClaren 650S
is find a straight bit of road, downshift a gear or two
then just....
do that.
Because the resulting acceleration

will leave you with a pretty big, dumb
smile on your face.
3.8 liter twin-turbo v8 that revs to 8500 rpm

it does terrific things with the power
that it makes and
below that you can hear the turbos

spool up too. In fack that's the first
thing when you hear when you get on
the throttle is that.
We're working with quite a bit of power here there are 641 horsepower

but the McLaren's very light too so that
power to weight

makes it feel so great when you power
out of corners.

That low weight is the byproduct of
having a construction

that basically built entirely at a
carbon fiber
at least the tub is.
The carbon fiber is

high strength but also low-weight and that
pays dividends throughout the car's performance.
What this car has in place of anti-roll bars is
basically a complex series of

hydraulics that link on the left side of
the car to the right side of the car

you know what that means is the car's
computer

can control the roll stiffness so when
you wanna go fast you can crank it over
to track
it tightens everything up.
But you wanna go cruise,
you know, commute whatever

go to local car show you can put it in
normal

and it softens up as a result is a a ride
quality

that feel really, really good you
don't get

this kind of comfort outta this kinda
car
unless you have a system like this.
This is obviously the Spyder version of the McLaren 650S.

And McLaren says there's basically no
downside to taking the roof off

that's another advantage on the carbon
fiber tub is that it's
so strong that you don't need that extra structural support
when you remove the roof.
Now let's just enjoy ourselves.
You simply have to love mid-engine supercars or mid engine in super sports cars.
They just feel so tight and together
especially when they're low weight and when so focussed on
performance it's really satisfying.
Even at 8/10ths right like we are.

All that combines to a car that's really
nice
to drive hard.

Then think of how nice it is to drive at
low speeds
how nice it is drive on a mountain road.
I guess next we'll have to find out how fast is around a racetrack.
Getting a little heat in the tires this morning at Willow Springs
they're Pirelli Courses
very aggressive compound
the McLaren feels light.
In the way that it's very quickly responding to the wheel.
Not much distribution in the front the weight distribution is actually
the same as the Porsche 911.
But the polar moment is what we live for.
Great arrow, sticks through the high speed corners.
I'll tell you what Willow Springs has got them too.
The flat plan crank V8 has a very European feel.
Smooth
revvy,
8500 rpm almost
650 horspower
we're over

Down into turn 1 moves around a little bit
of a break ground
not instability but you can kind of see
how the car dives a bit and moves around.
Can feel the breaks working hard.
They are giant carbon fiber
the McLaren stops really
well.
Wanders just a little bit in the process watch.
Not like that.
McLaren puts power down real well.

lower down so well it even called a
little bit of a power under stear
occasionally.
where it has a very sporting feel this

by that I mean there was a number I love
drop this
is going on

you can see me as I going to break a
string we'll have a little bit

because the program works better got a
lift off the throttle
this to give the car
the right at the front come down here

the most ever really good differentials
and I miss

because the curb with power down so well
on
like
start traveling return about 8500 rpm.
I can feel that arrow stick the tail here down thru turn 8

no school but a break from doing so wide
eyes ears
I'm lifting up your nose down on

I 650 s to be a real step forward from
the original
MP4 FC that we drove in Motor Trend's
Best Driver's Car a few years ago.

Though it's extremely fast on the track
it's the way the 650S behaved
on the road
that kept impressing us.
From its remarkably smooth ride
to the incredible power to the brakes steering, feel, and response
not to mention the amount of theater in that turbo spooling up in that moving rear wing.

There's something satisfying about a
supercar that's as potent as this one
but also as civilized.

It's a remarkable technical
accomplishment but that's just what
you'd expect from McLaren.
This is a good time to drive: top down, cool weather the loud car
Activate sport......
This thing doesn't have heated seats.
I'm trying to like, ah man I've been up since two o'clock in the morning.
For what?

You know it's going like nobody was
doing a hot cold flashes things
so like I bundle myself up like I'm so cold and like, arggg.

car company.

I'll share my thoughts...Slower than the Nissan GT-R Nismo and to put it in

from the Ring from Ferrari nor Mclaren. Yeah there slower than the Mighty

seconds around the track so please sit down GM fan boys. Yeah price but in 
this league price is just an after thought. ﻿

comments.author: Poofy Minion

comments.text:
Let me be clear, I'll take any supercar (if someone else pays for it, the 
gas, tires, tickets and insurance), however what are these cars really for? 
I suspect MOST owners don't take them to the track. Magazine and YouTube 
bloggers spend time reviewing the car for purposes the owner will never 
use. I suspect most of these cars spend their time cruising Ocean Blvd (in 
every town with an Ocean), appearing at the golf course, the high-end 
mall's valet parking area, taking the wife out for ice cream on Sunday, and 
parked in your driveway to show the neighbors you are rocking 2015 not 
their sleazy 2013 model. As such evaluate that...as art, or for single 
guys, as a way to pick up 10s.﻿

comments.author: Arjun Ullas

comments.text:
Can't believe that the Nismo is faster than the 650S. I watched it again 
and find out that the Nismo is faster at turn 2. That mainly due to AWD 
allows Randy to apply more throttle than the McLaren 650S. If he did it in 
the 650S, it'll power oversteer. At turn 4-5 it happens again. However, the 
GTR's weight disadvantage happened at turn 3, the weight pull the car out 
of apex and cause some mild oversteer. Both 650S and GTR Nismo are 
very good at turn in and mid corner maneuver, the steering angle can tell. 
Mild push and mild understeering.  The GTR Nismo did keep up with the 
McLaren 650S by better mid corner traction and turn out acceleration and 
the 650S catch the GTR Nismo back at the last corner and back straight.﻿

comments.text:
2015 Mclaren 650s Spyder vs 2015 Chevrolet Corvette Z06 Convertible . 

650s in a straight line will win all day but on the track it will be a more 
even match .

& before the vette haters talk shit realize that the Z06 performed the 
fastest figure 8 lap motortrend has ever recorded just behind the 1 million 
dollar Porsche 918 & also pulled the highest lateral G with 1.23 I believe 
while the 650s pulls a 1.05 G , meaning the vette can corner way faster 
than the Mclaren while keeping grip . 

Somehow the haters will find a way to discredit the car tho lol﻿
